Fitting result¶

After successful fitting, the variable fit is pushed to the console. This object is an instance of the class FitResult which provides access to fitted parameters and additional methods, such as confidence intervals estimation.

class fitwidget.FitResult(minimizer_result, minimizer, values_errors, current_model)[source]¶

Helper class that stores the results after fitting and provide additional functions such as printing or plotting confidence intervals.

result¶

Result from fitting as obtained by LMFIT.

Type

MinimizerResult

minimizer¶

Minimizer class used for fitting.

Type

Minimizer

params¶

Variable that stored parameters as MinimizerResult class

Type

Parameters

values_errors¶

2D numpy array of fitted paramater values (first column) and corresponding errors (second column)

Type

numpy.ndarray

model¶

Model used for fitting.

Type

_Model

confidence_interval2D(x_name, y_name, nx=10, ny=10)[source]¶

Draws a 2D confidence intervals using matplotlib.

Parameters

  • x_name (str) – Name of the variable that will be on the x axis.

  • y_name (str) – Name of the variable that will be on the y axis.

  • nx (int, optional) – Number of points in the x direction, default 10, the higher the value, better resolution, but slower.

  • ny (int, optional) – Number of points in the y direction, default 10, the higher the value, better resolution, but slower.

confidence_intervals(p_names=None, sigmas=(1, 2, 3))[source]¶

Prints a confidence intervals.

Parameters

  • p_names ({list, None}, optional) – Names of the parameters for which the confidence intervals are calculated. If None (default), the confidence intervals are calculated for every parameter.

  • sigmas ({list, tuple}, optional) – The sigma-levels to find (default is [1, 2, 3]). See Note below.

Note

The values for sigma are taken as the number of standard deviations for a normal distribution and converted to probabilities. That is, the default sigma=[1, 2, 3] will use probabilities of 0.6827, 0.9545, and 0.9973. If any of the sigma values is less than 1, that will be interpreted as a probability. That is, a value of 1 and 0.6827 will give the same results, within precision.

report(print=True)[source]¶

Prints a fit report if print == True, otherwise returns fit report as text.

Parameters

print (bool) – If True, fit report is printed.
